intro: Biscutella ebusitana, commonly known as the Ebusi biscuitflower, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the island of Ebusua in the Azores. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, thriving in the unique microclimates of its native habitat. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces capsule fruits containing numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Biscutella ebusitana is considered a vulnerable species.
